content.1: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, and it
content.2: A man to whom God hath given riches, wealth, and honour, so that he wanteth nothing for his soul of all that he desireth, yet God giveth him not power to eat thereof, but a stranger eateth it: this
content.3: If a man beget an hundred
content.4: For he cometh in with vanity, and departeth in darkness, and his name shall be covered with darkness.
content.5: Moreover he hath not seen the sun, nor known
content.6: Yea, though he live a thousand years twice
content.8: For what hath the wise more than the fool? what hath the poor, that knoweth to walk before the living?
content.10: That which hath been is named already, and it is known that it
content.11: Seeing there be many things that increase vanity, what
